page.title: 01Between Rivers Lyd &Thrushel
page.content: This area is disected by the A30 trunk road. Heavy lorries carry agricultural & horticultural produce throughout the year, and in the summer months there is additional heavy tourist traffic. The land falls away on each side of this road to the rivers Lyd and Thrushel whiuch flow through wooded valleys, and attract both local and visiting fishermen. The remaining land is devoted to grassland intensively cultivated to support dairy and beef cattle and sheep. People live either in small hamlets or in isolated farms or houses, and children are transported to schools outside the area, a limited number of private coaches take shoppers to nearby towns, but privately owned cars are essential for daily work and leisure pursuits.
